text: The Piedmontese regional election of 1970 took place on 7–8 June 1970. ==Events== Christian Democracy was by far the largest party and, after the election, it formed a government along with the Italian Socialist Party, the Unitary Socialist Party and the Italian Republican Party (organic Centre- left). The regional government was led by Edoardo Calleri di Sala until 1973 and then by Gianni Oberto Tarena, both Christian Democrats. ==Results== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%" |- bgcolor="EFEFEF" ! colspan=2 | Party ! votes ! votes (%) ! seats |- | bgcolor=white| | Christian Democracy | align=right|1,029,883 | align=right|36.7 | align=right|20 |- | bgcolor=red| | Italian Communist Party | align=right|727,619 | align=right|25.9 | align=right|13 |- | bgcolor=hotpink| | Italian Socialist Party | align=right|296,219 | align=right|10.6 | align=right|5 |- | bgcolor=pink| | Unitary Socialist Party | align=right|231,121 | align=right|8.2 | align=right|4 |- | bgcolor=blue| | Italian Liberal Party | align=right|225,395 | align=right|8.0 | align=right|4 |- | bgcolor=black| | Italian Social Movement | align=right|92,951 | align=right|3.3 | align=right|2 |- | bgcolor=deeppink| | Italian Socialist Party of Proletarian Unity | align=right|87,473 | align=right|3.1 | align=right|1 |- | bgcolor=lime| | Italian Republican Party | align=right|87,100 | align=right|3.1 | align=right|1 |- | | Italian Democratic Party of Monarchist Unity | align=right|28,025 | align=right|1.0 | align=right|- |- |- bgcolor="EFEFEF" | colspan=2 | Total | align=right|2,805,786 | align=right|100.0 | align=right|50 |- ! colspan=5 align=center|File:Piedmont_Council_1970.svg |- | colspan=5 align=center|Largest party by municipality |- ! colspan=5 align=center|File:Piemonte 1970.PNG |} Source: Ministry of the Interior Category:Elections in Piedmont Category:1970 elections in Italy
title: 1970 Piedmontese regional election
